main_text:
The Empire Strikes Back
4. The Empire Strikes Back


In 1977 a controversy erupted in lesbian-separatist circles over
Sandy Stone, an openly transsexual woman and an engineer who had been
working at Olivia Records (an all-woman recording company). Both she
and Olivia were explicitly targeted by Raymond in The Transsexual
Empire. After leaving Olivia, Stone earned her doctorate under
Donna Haraway at Santa Cruz, and in 1991 published a reply to Raymond
and what would become the founding essay in transgender
studies, “The Empire Strikes Back: A (post)transsexual
manifesto” (Stryker 2008, 105, 124–5).
hierarchy_title: Feminist Perspectives on Trans Issues || The Empire Strikes Back
